body_html:
Update: I am currently working on a change that introduces an option to make use of the unified memory supported by Pascal and newer GPUs. I will update this issue once that is available for use. After that, I will internally propose adding an option to specify memory limit as an absolute limit.

Regarding the "BFC-overflow" problem, that feels like a separate issue to me and is unexpected. Could you help file a different issue describing a way to reproduce the problem? Ideally, high memory usage should fail gracefully regardless of the unified memory support.

Thanks for adding more details about the use-case.
